item.title: Using a neural network control policy for rapid switching between beam parameters in an FEL
item.description: A. L. Edelen1, S. G. Biedron2, J. P. Edelen3, S. V. Milton4, P. J. M. van der Slot5 1Colorado State University, 2Element Aero, 3Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory, 4Los Alamos National Laboratory, 5University of Twente 38th International Free Electron Laser Conference Abstract FEL user facilities often must accommodate requests for a variety of beam parameters. This usually requires skilled operators to tune the machine, reducing the amount of available time for users.

item.title: Using Neural Network Control Policies For Rapid Switching Between Beam Parameters in a Free Electron Laser
item.description: A. L. Edelen1, S. G. Biedron2, J. P. Edelen3, S. V. Milton4, P. J. M. van der Slot5 1Colorado State University, 2Element Aero, 3Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory, 4Los Alamos National Laboratory, 5University of Twente Workshop on Deep Learning for Physical Sciences at the Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems 2017 Abstract Free Electron Laser (FEL) facilities often must accommodate requests for a varietyof electron beam parameters in order to supply scientific users with appropriatephoton beam characteristics.
